Ian Nepomniachtchi vs Shakhriyar Mamedyarov
Croatia Grand Chess Tour (2021) (rapid), round 2, Jul 7
King's Indian, Pomar system (E72)

1.c4 Nf6 2.g3 g6 3.Bg2 Bg7 4.Nc3 O-O 5.d4 d6 6.e4 e5 7.Nge2 exd4 8.Nxd4 Re8 9.O-O Nbd7 10.h3 a6 11.Re1 Rb8 12.Be3 Ne5 13.b3 c5 14.Nde2 b5 15.f4 Ned7 16.Qxd6 b4 17.e5 bxc3 18.Nxc3 Nh5 19.g4 Bf8 20.Qd2 Ng7 21.Nd5 f6 22.Rad1 fxe5 23.f5 Bb7 24.Bg5 Qc8 25.Rf1 gxf5 26.gxf5 Kh8 27.f6 Ne6 28.f7 Rd8 29.Nb6 Nxb6 30.Bf6+ Bg7 31.Qxd8+ Qxd8 32.Bxd8 Bxg2 33.Kxg2 Nf8 34.Be7 Nbd7 35.Rd6 e4 36.Re1 Bd4 37.Rxe4 Kg7 38.Rxa6 Kxf7 39.Bd6 Rc8 40.Re7+ Kg8 41.Ra7 Nf6 42.Rg7+ Kh8 43.Rgb7 Ne4 44.Rb8 Nxd6 45.Rxc8 Nxc8 46.Ra8 Nd6 47.Rxf8+ Kg7 48.Ra8 Bc3 49.a4 Nb7 50.Ra7

The Croatia Grand Chess Tour is the 3rd stage on the 2021 Grand Chess Tour, a series of five events with a total prize fund of $1.275 million. Ian Nepomniachtchi is top seed, while 13th World Champion Garry Kasparov will play the blitz after Ivan Saric plays the first three days of rapid chess.

The rapid is a 10-player single round-robin with 3 rounds each day on the first 3 days at a time control of 25 minutes for all moves and a 10-second increment from move 1. The final 2 days are a blitz double round-robin, with 18 rounds of 5+2 blitz. Rapid games count double, with 2 points for a win and 1 for a draw. Official website: grandchesstour.org
